string-array.item: Keep an average driving speed of 60mph to obtain the highest mileage efficiency
Use reusable coffee filters
Bring your own bags while grocery shopping
Eat less meat
Avoid products that are packaged for single use
Use a whiteboard instead of a note pad
Replace napkins with cloth napkins
Stop junk mail coming to your house
Cook from scratch at home
Microwave when possible instead of using a conventional oven
Replacing one incandescent lightbulb with a compact fluorescent light can save 150 pounds of carbon dioxide per year
Keep all windows and doors closed as tight as possible when heat or AC is running
Unplug appliances when not in use
Air dry clothing
Taking a quick shower uses less water than filling up a bathtub for a bath
Don\'t heat or cool an empty house
Carpooling will save on gas and money
Take your own mug to the coffee shop
Repair those leaky faucets as quickly as you can
Next time you have to re-paint use low or VOC-free paint
Support green businesses
Pay your bills online
Buy your firewood where you can to reduce the spread of invasive species
Use cold water, it saves energy
Pack your lunch in a reusable insulated lunch bag, not a paper bag
Use a reusable water bottle instead of buying a disposable one
Move your thermostat up 2 degrees in the summer to reduce carbon emission
Buy fresh, local food to eliminate the long distances traveled and preserve nutrients and flavor
Powering your home with solar panels can reduce your electric bills and shrink your carbon footprint
Make sure your household windows are properly sealed and not cracked
Dispose your batteries and electronics at the retailers you bought them form
Fully load your dishwasher instead of washing dishes by hand
Print on both sides of the paper when possible
Consider replacing old household appliances to newer, more efficient models
Use a low-flow showered to use 1 less gallon per minute while showering
